title: Nike’s Supply Crunch Stunts Growth Again
sub_head: Revenue declines in China, Asia Pacific and Latin America as factory closures cut into inventory
body:
Global supply-chain constraints continue to hurt Nike Inc.’s sales. The sneaker giant reported for a second consecutive quarter that its growth was stunted by a slowdown in production and transportation of its goods around the world.
Nike posted revenue of $11.4 billion in the quarter ended Nov. 30, up 1% from the same period a year earlier. Analysts expected revenue of $11.2 billion.
